p: Iridoids are a type of monoterpenoids in the general form of cyclopentanopyran and are found in a wide variety of plants as glucosides. 8-O-Acetylharpagide ( 99) and harpagide ( 100) are common iridoids in Lagochilus [ 6, 50, 52]. The latest results of our investigations showed that L. inebrians and L. gypcaseus are rich for 8-O-acetylharpagide [ 40, 50]. However, only a few (seven) iridoids could be reported in the genus. From the aerial parts of L. ilicifolius ajugoside ( 101), ajugol ( 102), geniposidic acid ( 103), mussaenosidic acid ( 104), and 8-deoxyshanzhiside ( 105) were identified and isolated [ 5, 58] ( Table 3, Figure S3).
